body_content.explanation: the particular state that something or someone is in:
examples: Mum's still got our pram - it's very old, but it's in perfect condition.
They left the flat in a terrible condition - there was mess everywhere.
The hospital say her condition (= state of health) is improving slowly.
He's in no condition (= he is too sick or too drunk) to drive home.

body_content.explanation: the physical situation that someone or something is in and affected by:
any of different types of diseases:
examples: to suffer from a heart/skin condition

body_content.explanation: not healthy enough for hard physical exercise, as a result of not taking part in sport or other physical activities:
examples: When he started boxing, he was overweight and out of condition.

body_content.explanation: an arrangement that must exist before something else can happen:
examples: One of the conditions in the contract is that we don't build on the land.
We're not in a position to make/set any conditions - we'll have to accept what they offer us.
Under the conditions of the agreement, she must vacate the house on 12 July .
I'll come to the party on the condition that you don't wear those ridiculous trousers!

body_content.explanation: to train or influence a person or animal mentally so that they do or expect a particular thing without thinking about it:
examples: Pavlov conditioned dogs to salivate at the sound of a bell.
Women were conditioned to expect lower wages than men.

body_content.explanation: to try to improve the quality or appearance of your hair, skin, etc. by putting a conditioner on it
